TopicTitle: [1.0.5] RSS Planets & Moons expanded v0.12.0 Sedna is finally here!

Articles.Content: This Mod looks awesome although I am playing on 1.2.2  with the latest version of <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> but it does not work with it 1.2.2. Is this mod dead or will it come to 1.2.2.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, flashfire2205 said:
> 
> 
> This Mod looks awesome although I am playing on 1.2.2  with the latest version of <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> but it does not work with it 1.2.2. Is this mod dead or will it come to 1.2.2.
> 

I posted the answer to this exact question in the last post before yours

I suggest you take a look at least at the last post on a thread before asking questions that might be already answered
Do you still have to make a new save when you install this mod? I've heared that it screwes up all of your spacecrafts earlier. Is this still an issue?

I am very curious if this mod is now dead or has someone agreed to have taken it over. 

Just a little info would be appreciated.

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, Wallygator said:
> 
> 
> I am very curious if this mod is now dead or has someone agreed to have taken it over. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Just a little info would be appreciated.
> 

~~Most likely still worx... Just make sure you use the latest Kopernicus~~

 Seems I was incorrect.  

See PhineasFreak's reply two posts down

**Edited <time datetime="2019-01-04T14:20:56Z" title="01/04/2019 02:20  PM" data-short="5 yr">January 4, 2019</time> by Stone Blue**
  
Correction on incorrect info

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> Most likely still worx... Just make sure you use the latest Kopernicus
> 

Thanks for that. I’ll give it a try and report back in a few days.

You are going to have a really bad time using the old pack, considering that some of the bodies are now part of <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> itself and they will conflict and most probably crash KSP on load.

Link: [https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSExpansion](https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSExpansion) (although more or less in maintenance - only mode).

OK so... providing a bit of a status report:

I was able to get both <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> and <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> Extended to run well (so far) on 1.6.0.  Haven't launched anything yet.  Plugged in <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> as well, which seems to run fine.

Some flashing orbit lines at times - but nothing obtrusive.

Had to delete the principia cfg file in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> Extended - to avoid a couple of loading errors, that's all.

Can you open a GitHub issue and post a log file there? I am aware that some things have changed in the newer <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> versions but i never tested the pack using them. Or it may be just a stupid typo...

**Edit:** and most probably **it was** a stupid typo (well, multiple). Grab the latest Principia config file from the repo and try again.

Thanks [@Phineas Freak](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/146521-phineas-freak/).  I'm still poking around.  Might delete <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> on my current instance due to not having Real Fuels available.

As to to RSSex principia config error, I'll see if I can figure out how to post on Github. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") worst case I'll PM you any info I have.

However, as it stands now, this mod works brilliantly with 1.6.0 and the current version of Kopernicus from my perspective - the minor issues are really minor.

It's nice to see Sedna again - and to scratch my head as to how to get there...

This is actually a stock bug that is only apparent when using Kopernicus to install packs with bodies that are far away from Sun, basically, things orbiting really far out suffer from this issue but in the stock game Eeloo is not far enough out to make this apparent.
Woohoo! Now to study Kopernicus PQSMods to help modelize UltimaThule!

**Edited <time datetime="2019-01-12T13:05:24Z" title="01/12/2019 01:05  PM" data-short="5 yr">January 12, 2019</time> by Wallygator**
  
clarification

For [https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSExpansion](https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSExpansion)

[@Phineas Freak](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/146521-phineas-freak/) [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/)

Resonant Orbit Calculator cache files for this mod:  
[https://www.dropbox.com/sh/9ll3hou5neyjhqp/AADYthnmlbJGGNMAoQdk0Pkga?dl=1](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/9ll3hou5neyjhqp/AADYthnmlbJGGNMAoQdk0Pkga?dl=1)

Why do I post this?

Because with Kopernicus useOnDemand = true all cache files are black.  

So I created them.

> 
> 
> https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/177216-161-real-solar-system-v162-19-apr-2019/&page=17&tab=comments# Quote
> 
> 
> Disable Kopernicus onDemand where you find it:  
> 
>     %useOnDemand = False  
> 
>     %useManualMemoryManagement = False  
>   
> 
> Don't forget to reenable it after the testing.  
>   
> 
> Delete the files in  
> 
> GameData\ResonantOrbitCalculator\PluginData\Cache\  
> 
> then start the game one time.  
> 
> Get to the Main Menu, wait a minute and then exit the game.  
>   
> 
> --  
>   
> 
> The cache files will not be overwritten once created, so you could set up a test install with only the planets, make a backup of the created cache and then copy the cache directly over on reinstalling the mod.  
>   
> 
> You need at least:  
>   
> 
> 000\_ClickThroughBlocker\  
> 
> 001\_ToolbarControl\  
> 
> CTTP\  
> 
> EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements\  
> 
> Kopernicus\  
> 
> ModularFlightIntegrator\  
> 
> ResonantOrbitCalculator\  
> 
> Squad\  
>   
> 
> plus everything what belongs to the planet pack, like for example for <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> with RSSVE:  
> 
> KSCSwitcher\  
> 
> RealSolarSystem\  
> 
> RSSDateTime\  
> <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>-Textures\  
> 
> RSSVE\
>
Have you ever considered pushing this to <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>?
